item.title: Linux 内核将支持开箱即用的实时调度特性
item.description:
1. Extract 3 Keywords of the Article

  • PREEMPT_RT
  • Real-Time Scheduling
  • Linux 6.12

2. Concise and Informative Summary

The article discusses the upcoming integration of real-time scheduling features into the Linux 6.12 kernel through the PREEMPT_RT patch. This enhancement, which has been in development since 2005, will enable Linux to support deterministic time guarantees, crucial for applications in aviation, robotics, automotive, and communication sectors. It also improves desktop user experiences by reducing latency. The integration requires resolving issues like optimizing the printk function to ensure low-latency performance. Users can now enable real-time capabilities by simply setting the CONFIG_PREEMPT* option during compilation. Running real-time Linux has previously been simplified with Ubuntu Pro, but the mainstream integration marks a significant milestone in making real-time computing more accessible and reliable.

3. Outline of the Whole Article

  1. Introduction: Linux 6.12 will include official support for real-time scheduling via PREEMPT_RT.
  2. Background: PREEMPT_RT has been developed since 2005 to enable hard and soft real-time computing on various architectures.
  3. Benefits: Real-time scheduling is crucial for applications requiring deterministic time guarantees and can improve desktop user experiences.
  4. Integration Challenges: Issues like optimizing the printk function need to be addressed to ensure low latency.
  5. Previous Solutions: Ubuntu Pro has simplified running real-time Linux, but mainstream integration is a significant step forward.
  6. Real-Time vs. Performance: Real-time focuses on predictable task preemption, not just performance.
  7. User Experiences: Real-time Linux can reduce interrupt latency and improve user experiences in various applications.
  8. Future Release: Linux 6.12 is expected to release in late November 2024, with candidate versions available for testing.

4. Overall Recommendation Degree

A

Analysis: - Pros: - The article provides a comprehensive overview of the integration of PREEMPT_RT into Linux 6.12. - It clearly explains the benefits and technical challenges of real-time scheduling. - The information is well-organized and easy to understand. - It includes practical examples and user experiences to illustrate the impact of real-time scheduling. - Cons: - The article could provide more technical details about the specific changes made to the printk function. - It briefly mentions Ubuntu Pro but does not delve into its limitations or advantages in detail.

5. Who May Be Interested in This Content

  • Software Developers: Especially those working on real-time systems.
  • System Administrators: Interested in improving system performance and reliability.
  • Embedded Systems Engineers: Working in industries like aviation, robotics, and automotive.
  • Linux Enthusiasts: Curious about the latest developments in the Linux kernel.

6. Thought-Provoking Questions

  1. What are the key differences between hard real-time and soft real-time systems, and how does PREEMPT_RT support both?
  2. How does the optimization of the printk function contribute to achieving low-latency performance in real-time Linux?
  3. In what ways can the integration of PREEMPT_RT into the Linux 6.12 kernel benefit desktop users beyond just reducing latency?
